intro: Strobocalyx obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed strobocalyx, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, obovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that dehisces to release seeds, a feature typical of the genus Strobocalyx. It is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
